scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The hospital, Ross, Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are in the waiting room,
waiting for Carol and Susan to arrive.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She's not here yet. She's not here. She's having my baby and she's not here.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sure everything's fine. Has her water broke yet?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't know, but when I spoke to her, she said she had already passed the mucus plug.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Do we have to know about that?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, what are you gonna do when you have a baby?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm gonna be in the waitin' room, handing out cigars.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, Joey's made arrangements to have his baby in a movie from the 50's.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: God, I don't believe this. She could be giving birth in the cab.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Ross, relax. It's probably like two dollars for the first contraction, and then fifty cents for each additional contraction.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What, it's ok when Chandler does it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You have to pick your moments.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Did I miss it, did I miss it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She's not even here yet.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What's with the guitar?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I just thought we might be here for awhile. You know, things might get musical.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Carol) Where the hell have you been?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: We stopped at the gift shop.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I was looking at stuffed animals, and Susan wanted a Chunky .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Susan wanted a Chunky . We're having a baby, ok, a baby, you don't stop for Chunky s.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I used to have that bumper sticker.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) You see what I mean.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol's Hospital Room, Carol is on the bed, Ross and Susan are at her side.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Stopped for a Chunky .

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Let it go, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: I got an extra one. You want this? (holds the candy in front of Ross' face)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (weakly) No.

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: Hey, how's my favorite parenting team doing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Dr. Franzblau, hi.

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: So, I understand you're thinking of having a baby? Well, I see you're nine months pregnant. That's a good start. How you doing with your contractions?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh, I love them. Each one's like a little party in my uterus.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: They're every four minutes and last 55 seconds.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 59 seconds. (holds up his watch) Quartz, ha.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Swiss quartz, ha, ha.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Am I allowed to drink anything?

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: Ice chips, just ice chips. They're at the nurses' station.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'll get it.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: No, I'm getting it. I'll be right back.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I got it—I'm getting it!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi, I thought you might like some ice chips.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And if you need anything else, I—(notices the handsome Dr. Franzblau)—do not believe we've met. Hi. I'm, uh, Rachel Green. I'm Carol's... ex-husband's... sister's roommate.

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: It is nice to meet you. I'm Dr. Franzblau. I'm your roommate's... brother's... ex-wife's obstetrician.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, that's funny!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Waiting Room, Chandler is falling asleep on Monica's shoulder.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I want a baby.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Mmmm. Not tonight, honey. I got an early day tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Get up. Come on. Let's get some coffee.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, ok, 'cause we never do that.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to the screen) Shoot! Shoot! Shoot! Shoot, or just fall down. That's good too.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Knick fan?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Oh, boy, do they suck.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, listen, lady....(sees that she's pregnant)...whoa.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Look, look at your man, Ewing. Nice shot. You know what, he couldn't hit water if he was standing on a boat.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah? And who do you like?

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: The Celtics.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: The Celtics? Ha. They couldn't hit a boat if...wait. They suck, alright?

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Oh, shut up. You know, it's a rebuilding year. You... waah!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wha? Wha..aa? Let me get the father. Hey, we need a father over here! We need a father!

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: There is no father.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, oh, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Ok, that's ok. I'm fine. I'm... oh!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, uh, ok. Right this way. All the other pregnant women seem to be goin' in here.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Ok.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Waiting Room, Phoebe is playing a song. Chandler, Monica, and Ross are
there as well.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (singing)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Thanks, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. I'm paying you to stop.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, look, twins. Hi, guys. Oh, cute, cute.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No fair. I don't even have one. How come they get two?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You'll get one.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh yeah? When?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right. I'll tell you what. When we're 40, if neither one of us are married, what do you say you and I get together and have one?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why won't I be married when I'm 40?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, no, no. I just meant hypothetically.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ok, hypothetically, why won't I be married when I'm 40?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no, no.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What is it? Is there something fundamentally unmarriable about me?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (trapped) Uh, uh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Dear God! This parachute is a knapsack! (throws himself over the back of the chair he was sitting in)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey. Ooh, look at you, dressy-dress.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did you go home and change?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, it's an important day. I wanna look nice. Um, has uh Dr. Franzblau been by?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, I haven't seen him.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, where is he? He is supposed to be here. (Pause) What if the baby needs him?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Rachel, what is the deal with you and doctors, anyway? Was, like, your father a doctor?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, why?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No reason. (turns around, makes an 'Oh my God' gesture with his eyes)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Joey and Lydia in the hospital room. Lydia is on the phone with her mother.]

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Mom, we've been through this. No, I'm not calling him. I don't care if it is his kid, the guy's a jerk. No, I'm not alone. Joey's here. (pause) What do you mean, Joey who? (covers the phone, to Joey) Joey who?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Tribbiani.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Joey Tribbiani. Yes, ok. Hold on. (to Joey) She wants to talk to you. Take the phone.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (takes phone) Hi, yeah, it's me. (Listens) Oh, no no no, we're just friends. (Listens) Yeah, I'm single. (Listens) 25. (Listens) An actor. (Listens) Hello?

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: She's not much of a phone person.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, so, uh, so, uh, what's the deal with this father guy, I mean, if someone was havin' my baby somewhere, I'd wanna know about it, you know?

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Hey, Knick fan, am I interested in your views on fatherhood? Uh, no.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ok, look, maybe I should just go.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Maybe you should.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Good luck, and uh, take care, huh?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You know what the Celtics problem is? They let the players run the team.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Oh, that is so not true.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, it is.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: It isn't.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It is.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Isn't!

scenes.location: Joey and Lydia in the hospital room. Lydia is on the phone with her mother.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol's Hospital Room, Ross and Susan are coaching Carol.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Breathe.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Breathe.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Breathe.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Breathe.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Breathe.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Breathe.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: You're gonna kill me!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 15 more seconds, 14, 13, 12...

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Count faster.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: It's gonna be ok, just remember, we're doing this for Jordie. Just keep focusing on Jordie.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Who the hell is Jordie?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Your son.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No-no-no. I don't have a son named Jordie. We all agreed, my son's name is Jamie.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Well, Jamie was the name of Susan's first girlfriend, so we went back to Jordie.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? Whoa, whoa whoa whoa, what do you mean, back to Jordie? We never landed on Jordie. We just passed by it during the whole Jessy, Cody, Dylan fiasco.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ow, ow, ow, ow, leg cramp, leg cramp, leg cramp.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I got it.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: I got it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I got it! Hey, you get to sleep with her, I get the cramps.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: No, you don't.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: All right, that's it. I want both of you out.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: He started it!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, you started it.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: You did!

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I don't care. I am trying to get a person out of my body here, and you're not making it any easier.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: But...

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Now go!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Susan) Thanks a lot.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: (to Ross) See what you did.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Carol) Yeah, listen...

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Out !

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Lydia's Hospital Room, Joey is helping Lydia go through labor, a nurse is now
present in her room as well.]

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: Breathe, breathe, breathe...

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Oh, no.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ew! What is that? Something exploded!

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: It's just her water breaking. Calm down, will you?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (panicked) Water breaking, what do you mean? What's that, water breaking?

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Breathe, breathe, breathe.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Hall, Ross and Susan are arguing.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Please. This is so your fault.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: How, how is this my fault?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, Carol never threw me out of a room before you came along.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Yeah? Well, there's a lot of things Carol never did before I came along.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You tryin' to be clever? A funny lady?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: You know what your problem is? You're threatened by me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm threatened by you?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, hey, ok, all right, that's it! Get in here. Come on. My god, you guys, I don't believe you. There are children coming into the world in this very building and your negative fighting noises are not the first thing they should be hearing. So just stop all the yelling, just stop it!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, Susan.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Don't make me do this again, I don't like my voice like this.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, who wants to hear something ironic?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Broom Closet, Ross and Susan are trying to get out.]

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Help!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm having a baby in here! Ok, everyone stand back. (Walks backwards as if he is going to break down the door, but steps in a bucket and falls) Ow.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol's room, Rachel and Dr. Franzblau are there with her.]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Are they here yet?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, honey, they're not, but don't worry, because we are going to find them, and until we do, we are all here for you, ok?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ok.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ok.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Dr. Franzblau) Ok, so anyway, you were telling me about Paris, it sounds fascinating.

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: It really was. There was this great little pastry shop right by my hotel. (Carol sits up in pain, Rachel and Dr. Franzblau casually lay her back down) There you go, dear.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Lydia's Room, Joey is helping her deliver.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on, Lydia, you can do it. Push! Push 'em out, push 'em out, harder, harder. Push 'em out, push 'em out, way out! Let's get that ball and really move, hey, hey, ho, ho. Let's— (notices the nurse looking at him strangely) I was just—yeah, right. Push! Push!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Broom Closet, Ross has picked up a vacuum and is holding it at the door.]

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: What're you gonna do, suck the door open?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Help! Help!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (singing) They found their bodies the very next day, they found their bodies the very next...(sees Ross and Susan staring at her) la la la la la la.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN AND ROSS
dialogue.text: (even louder) Help!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Waiting Room, Monica is on the phone with her mother, Chandler is standing
behind her.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Now, Mom, everything's going fine, really. (Listens) Yeah, Ross is great. He's uh, he's in a whole other place. (Listens) No, he's gone. (Listens) No no, you don't have to fly back, really. (Listens) What do you mean this might be your only chance? (Listens) Would you stop? I'm only 26, I'm not even thinking about babies yet.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Where have you been?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, just had a baby.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Mazel tov!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Waiting Room, Rachel and Dr. Franzblau have gone to get coffee.]

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: I don't know, could be an hour, could be three, but relax, she's doing great. So, uh, tell me, are you currently involved with anyone?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (anxiously) No, no, not at the moment, no, I'm not. Are you?

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: No, it's hard enough to get women to go out with me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Right, yeah, I've heard that about cute doctors.

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: No, no, really. I suppose it's because I spend so much time, you know, where I do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: I try not to let my work affect my personal life, but it's hard, when you... do what I do. It's like uh...Well, for instance, what do you do?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm a waitress.

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: Ok, all right, well aren't there times when you come home at the end of the day, and you're just like, 'if I see one more cup of coffee'...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (getting the point) Yeah. Gotcha.

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: I'm gonna go check up on your friend.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok. That's fine. (takes her earrings out)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Hall Outside Lydia's Room, Joey is walking up to Lydia's room with
balloons, but before he enters he sees that the baby's father has arrived. He listens at
the door.]

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: So how did you know I was even here?

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Your mom called me. So is this her?

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: No, this is a loaner.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: I'm sorry you had to do this by yourself.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: I wasn't by myself. I had a doctor, a nurse, and a helper guy. (Joey smiles) So, did you see who won the game?

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Yeah, the Knicks by 10. They suck.

dialogue.speaker: LYDIA
dialogue.text: Yeah, they're not so bad.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Broom Closet, Ross is trying to open the door with a credit card, with no
success.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on, come on. Damnit, damnit, damnit, damnit. (to Susan) This is all your fault. This is supposed to be, like, the greatest day of my life, y'know? My son is being born, and I should be in there, you know, instead of stuck in a closet with you.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: The woman I love is having a baby today. I've been waiting for this just as much as you have.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No no no, believe me. No one has been waiting for this as much as I have, ok? And you know what the funny thing is? When this day is over, you get to go home with the baby, ok? Where does that leave me?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: You get to be the baby's father. Everyone knows who you are. Who am I? There's Mother's Day, there's Father's Day, there's no... Lesbian Lover Day.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Every day is Lesbian Lover Day.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: This is so great.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You wanna explain that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I mean, well, 'cause when I was growing up, you know my dad left, and my mother died, and my stepfather went to jail, so I barely had enough pieces of parents to make one whole one. And here's this little baby who has like three whole parents who care about it so much that they're fighting over who gets to love it the most. And it's not even born yet. It's just, it's just the luckiest baby in the whole world. (pause) I'm sorry, you were fighting.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Carol's Room, she is ready to give birth. Everyone is there except for Phoebe,
Ross, and Susan, who are in the broom closet.]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Where are they?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sure they'll be here soon.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, honey, they wouldn't miss this.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Relax. You're only at nine centimeters. And the baby's at zero station.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Joey) You are really frightening me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Somebody wanna help me, tryin' to rip out my heart. (they pull her hand off of him) Uh, that's great. (looking around) Anybody seen a nipple?

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: All right, ten centimeters, here we go.

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: All right, honey, time to start pushing.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: But they're not here yet!

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I can't tell the baby to wait for them.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh, god.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Broom Closet, Ross has used a broom to open the air vent in the ceiling.
Phoebe is wearing a janitor's uniform, ready to go up in the vent.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, got the vent open.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (reading the nametag on the uniform) Hi, I'm Ben. I'm hospital worker Ben. It's Ben... to the rescue!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ben, you ready? All right, gimme your foot. Ok, on three, Ben. One, two, three. Ok, That's it, Ben.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: What do you see?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, Susan, I see what appears to be a dark vent. Wait. Yes, it is in fact a dark vent.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Phoebs, It's open! It's open!

dialogue.speaker: JANITOR
dialogue.text: (to Ross and Susan) Wait! You forgot your legs!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Carol's Room, Ross and Susan rush in.]

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Push, push!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We're here!

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: (irked) Where have you been?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Long story, honey.

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: All right, Carol, I need you to keep pushing. I need—(reaches for an instrument, Rachel's hand is on it) Excuse me, could I have this?

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: All right, all right, there's a few too many people in this room, and there's about to be one more, so anybody who's not an ex-husband or a lesbian life partner, out you go!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Good luck!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to nurse) Let me ask you, do you have to be Carol's lesbian life partner?

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: Out!

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: All right, he's crowning. Here he comes.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Let me see, I gotta see, I gotta see. Oh, a head. Oh, it's, it's huge. Carol, how are you doing this?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: (straining) Not.... helping!

dialogue.speaker: DR. FRANZBLAU
dialogue.text: You're doing great, you're doing fine.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (puts his head near the baby) Hello! (to Dr. Franzblau) Oh, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: What do you see? What do you see?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We got a head, we got shoulders, we got arms, we got, oh, look at the little fingers, oh, and a chest, and a stomach. It's a boy, definitely a boy! All right! Ok, legs, knees, and feet. Oh, oh. He's here. He's a person.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Oh, look at that.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: What does he look like?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Kinda like my uncle Ed, covered in Jell-o .

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (from the air vent overhead) You guys, he's beautiful!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, thanks, Pheebs!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Delivery Room, Carol is holding the infant.]

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: No shouting, but we still need a name for this little guy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (thinking) How 'bout Ben?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: I like Ben.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ben. Ben. Ben's good. How come you never mentioned Ben before?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We uh, we just cooked it up.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: That's what we were off doing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Can we come in?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Ben) I know, I know. Everybody, there's someone I'd like you to meet. Yeah. This is Ben. Ben, this is everybody.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Susan, he looks just like you.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, god, I can't believe one of us actually has one of these.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know, I still am one of these.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ross, can I?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The head, the head. You gotta...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (getting choked up) Hi, Ben. Hi. I'm your Aunt Monica. Yes I am. I'm your Aunt Monica. I...I will always have gum.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Hospital, the camera is placed as though it were Ben's eyes.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ben, I want you to know that there may be some times when I may not be around, like this. (walks out of the picture) But I'll still always come back, like this. (returns) And sometimes I may be away longer, like this. (walks away) But I'll still always come back, like this. (returns)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And sometimes, I'll want you to steal third, and I'll go like this. (Does a baseball sign.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He is so amazing.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I know. Look at him.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ben, Ben, hey Ben. Nothing. I don't think that's his name.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, look, look, he's closing his eyes. (screen goes blank) Look, he's opening his eyes. (picture comes back)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: He doesn't do much, does he?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, this is pretty much it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You guys wanna get some coffee?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All right, I'll see you guys later.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, look, he's closing his eyes again.
